page.title: 04BARNACK VILLAGE
page.content: Barnack dates back a long way.Like most villages its centre is the church, which is partly Saxon and Norman.The oldest buildings are close to the church-The Old Corner House -1684,The Old Post Office-1786 Cedar House-1814,and Kingsley House -author of The Water Babies.They are built of old limestone called Barnack Ragstone-the rooves are Collyweston slate,blue slate and some are thatched Many of the walls are very old with interesting features-a stone arched doorway and gargoyles.The old school which is now the village hall was built in 1864 and used as a school until the 1950's.In the 1950's other houses on the Uffington and Bainton Road were built-between them are large trees which are excellent for dens and hideouts.The present school was built in the 1950's.
